verses.verse: Now Sarai <WH8297> Abram's <WH87> wife <WH802> bare <WH3205> him no <WH3808> children <WH3205>: and she had an handmaid <WH8198>, an Egyptian <WH4713>, whose name <WH8034> was Hagar <WH1904>.

And Sarai <WH8297> said <WH559> unto Abram <WH87>, Behold now, the LORD <WH3068> hath restrained me <WH6113> from bearing <WH3205>: I pray thee, go in <WH935> unto my maid <WH8198>; it may <WH194> be that I may obtain children <WH1129> by her. And Abram <WH87> hearkened <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of Sarai <WH8297>. obtain: Heb. be built by her

And Sarai <WH8297> Abram's <WH87> wife <WH802> took <WH3947> Hagar <WH1904> her maid <WH8198> the Egyptian <WH4713>, after <WH7093> Abram <WH87> had dwelt <WH3427> ten <WH6235> years <WH8141> in the land <WH776> of Canaan <WH3667>, and gave <WH5414> her to her husband <WH376> Abram <WH87> to be his wife <WH802>.
And he went in <WH935> unto Hagar <WH1904>, and she conceived <WH2029>: and when she saw <WH7200> that she had conceived <WH2029>, her mistress <WH1404> was despised <WH7043> in her eyes <WH5869>.

And Sarai <WH8297> said <WH559> unto Abram <WH87>, My wrong <WH2555> be upon thee: I have given <WH5414> my maid <WH8198> into thy bosom <WH2436>; and when she saw <WH7200> that she had conceived <WH2029>, I was despised <WH7043> in her eyes <WH5869>: the LORD <WH3068> judge <WH8199> between me and thee.

But Abram <WH87> said <WH559> unto Sarai <WH8297>, Behold, thy maid <WH8198> is in thy hand <WH3027>; do <WH6213> to her as it pleaseth thee <WH2896> <WH5869>. And when Sarai <WH8297> dealt hardly with <WH6031> her, she fled <WH1272> from her face <WH6440>. as: Heb. that which is good in thine eyes dealt: Heb. afflicted her
And the angel <WH4397> of the LORD <WH3068> found her <WH4672> by a fountain <WH5869> of water <WH4325> in the wilderness <WH4057>, by the fountain <WH5869> in the way <WH1870> to Shur <WH7793>.

And he said <WH559>, Hagar <WH1904>, Sarai's <WH8297> maid <WH8198>, whence <WH335> camest thou <WH935>? and whither wilt thou go <WH3212>? And she said <WH559>, I flee <WH1272> from the face <WH6440> of my mistress <WH1404> Sarai <WH8297>.
And the angel <WH4397> of the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her, Return <WH7725> to thy mistress <WH1404>, and submit <WH6031> thyself under her hands <WH3027>.
And the angel <WH4397> of the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her, I will multiply <WH7235> thy seed <WH2233> exceedingly <WH7235>, that it shall not be numbered <WH5608> for multitude <WH7230>.

And the angel <WH4397> of the LORD <WH3068> said <WH559> unto her, Behold <WH2009>, thou art with child <WH2030>, and shalt bear <WH3205> a son <WH1121>, and shalt call <WH7121> his name <WH8034> Ishmael <WH3458>; because the LORD <WH3068> hath heard <WH8085> thy affliction <WH6040>. Ishmael: that is, God shall hear

And he will be a wild <WH6501> man <WH120>; his hand <WH3027> will be against every man, and every man's hand <WH3027> against him; and he shall dwell <WH7931> in the presence <WH6440> of all his brethren <WH251>.

And she called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the LORD <WH3068> that spake <WH1696> unto her, Thou God <WH410> seest me <WH7210>: for she said <WH559>, Have I also here <WH1988> looked <WH7200> after him <WH310> that seeth me <WH7210>?
Wherefore the well <WH875> was called <WH7121> Beerlahairoi <WH883> <WH2416>; behold, it is between Kadesh <WH6946> and Bered <WH1260>. Beerlahairoi: that is, The well of him that liveth and seeth me
And Hagar <WH1904> bare <WH3205> Abram <WH87> a son <WH1121>: and Abram <WH87> called <WH7121> his son's <WH1121> name <WH8034>, which Hagar <WH1904> bare <WH3205>, Ishmael <WH3458>.
And Abram <WH87> was fourscore <WH8084> <WH8141> and six <WH8337> years <WH8141> old <WH1121>, when Hagar <WH1904> bare <WH3205> Ishmael <WH3458> to Abram <WH87>.
